gospel.text:
[[Lc 2,41]]Each year Jesus' parents went to Jerusalem for the feast of Passover,
[[Lc 2,42]]and when he was twelve years old, they went up according to festival custom.
[[Lc 2,43]]After they had completed its days, as they were returning, the boy Jesus remained behind in Jerusalem, but his parents did not know it.
[[Lc 2,44]]Thinking that he was in the caravan, they journeyed for a day and looked for him among their relatives and acquaintances,
[[Lc 2,45]]but not finding him, they returned to Jerusalem to look for him.
[[Lc 2,46]]After three days they found him in the temple, sitting in the midst of the teachers, listening to them and asking them questions,
[[Lc 2,47]]and all who heard him were astounded at his understanding and his answers.
[[Lc 2,48]]When his parents saw him, they were astonished, and his mother said to him, "Son, why have you done this to us? Your father and I have been looking for you with great anxiety."
[[Lc 2,49]]And he said to them, "Why were you looking for me? Did you not know that I must be in my Father's house?"
[[Lc 2,50]]But they did not understand what he said to them.
[[Lc 2,51]]He went down with them and came to Nazareth, and was obedient to them; and his mother kept all these things in her heart.
gospel.title: Holy Gospel of Jesus Christ according to Saint Luke

first_reading.text:
[[Is 61,9]]Thus says the Lord: The descendants of my people shall be renowned among the nations, and their offspring among the peoples; All who see them shall acknowledge them as a race the LORD has blessed.
[[Is 61,10]]I rejoice heartily in the LORD, in my God is the joy of my soul; For he has clothed me with a robe of salvation, and wrapped me in a mantle of justice, Like a bridegroom adorned with a diadem, like a bride bedecked with her jewels.
[[Is 61,11]]As the earth brings forth its plants, and a garden makes its growth spring up, So will the Lord GOD make justice and praise spring up before all the nations.
first_reading.title: Book of Isaiah

psalm.text:
[[1_S 2,1]]My heart exults in the LORD, 
my horn is exalted in my God. 
I have swallowed up my enemies; 
I rejoice in my victory.

[[1_S 2,4]]The bows of the mighty are broken, 
while the tottering gird on strength.
[[1_S 2,5]]The well-fed hire themselves out for bread, 
while the hungry batten on spoil. 
The barren wife bears seven sons, 
while the mother of many languishes.

[[1_S 2,6]]The LORD puts to death and gives life; 
He casts down to the nether world; 
He raises up again.
[[1_S 2,7]]The LORD makes poor and makes rich, 
He humbles, he also exalts.

[[1_S 2,8a]]He raises the needy from the dust;
[[1_S 2,8b]]from the dung heap he lifts up the poor,
[[1_S 2,8c]]to seat them with nobles
[[1_S 2,8d]]and make a glorious throne their heritage.
psalm.title: 1st book of Samuel
